definitions: Any program that sends an HTTP request.
Any program that can listen to and respond to an HTTP request on a network.
A queue of functions to be executed by the JavaScript engine after the call stack has been exhausted
A declarative language used to provide structure for a text document.
A language used to style HTML documents in the browser.
The current stack of functions for the JavaScript engine to evaluate
A text based protocol used to exchange information over the Web
A key value pair transferred before the HTTP body that allows arbitrary metadata to be sent with an HTTP Request or Response
An open-source document-oriented database management system.
Software which abstracts the retrival, creation, and updating of data in a database.
A browser-based API that lets users send arbitrary HTTP requests
A node.js standard library that let's a program to communicate with the File System
